segment.source: MD Conversion - Windows 10 configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Windows 10 configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Windows 10 configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Windows 10 configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Use the general configuration policy for Windows 10 to configure settings for enrolled Windows 10 desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile devices:
segment.target: Use the general configuration policy for Windows 10 to configure settings for enrolled Windows 10 desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile devices:

segment.source: Create a Windows 10 general configuration policy
segment.target: Create a Windows 10 general configuration policy

segment.source: To provide basic settings for the configuration policy
segment.target: To provide basic settings for the configuration policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.

segment.source: Click Windows > General Configuration (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later) and then click Create Policy.
segment.target: Click Windows > General Configuration (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later) and then click Create Policy.

segment.source: You cannot create a configuration policy using recommended settings.
segment.target: You cannot create a configuration policy using recommended settings.

segment.source: You must create a custom policy.
segment.target: You must create a custom policy.

segment.source: In the General section of the Create Policy page, specify a name and a description for the new policy.
segment.target: In the General section of the Create Policy page, specify a name and a description for the new policy.

segment.source: Use the information in the following sections to help you supply settings for the policy.
segment.target: Use the information in the following sections to help you supply settings for the policy.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Require a password to unlock devices
segment.target: Require a password to unlock devices

segment.source: (Specifies the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only, or alphanumeric)
segment.target: (Specifies the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only, or alphanumeric)

segment.source: Required password type - Minimum number of character sets
segment.target: Required password type - Minimum number of character sets

segment.source: (There are four character sets, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.
segment.target: (There are four character sets, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.

segment.source: This setting specifies how many different character sets must be included in the password).
segment.target: This setting specifies how many different character sets must be included in the password).

segment.source: This setting is no longer supported and will be removed in the future.
segment.target: This setting is no longer supported and will be removed in the future.

segment.source: You can use the setting for Windows 10 Mobile below for desktop computers.
segment.target: You can use the setting for Windows 10 Mobile below for desktop computers.

segment.source: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped
segment.target: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped

segment.source: Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off
segment.target: Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off

segment.source: Remember password history - Prevent reuse of previous passwords
segment.target: Remember password history - Prevent reuse of previous passwords

segment.source: Lets you use simple gestures on a picture, or a simple PIN to login.
segment.target: Lets you use simple gestures on a picture, or a simple PIN to login.

segment.source: Require a password when the device returns from an idle state
segment.target: Require a password when the device returns from an idle state

segment.source: Lets the user manually delete the workplace account from the device.
segment.target: Lets the user manually delete the workplace account from the device.

segment.source: Specifies whether the user can manually install root certificates
segment.target: Specifies whether the user can manually install root certificates

segment.source: Allow diagnostic and usage data to be sent to Microsoft
segment.target: Allow diagnostic and usage data to be sent to Microsoft

segment.source: Allow settings synchronization for Microsoft accounts
segment.target: Allow settings synchronization for Microsoft accounts

segment.source: Make Microsoft account optional in Windows Mail application
segment.target: Make Microsoft account optional in Windows Mail application

segment.source: Allow search suggestions in address bar
segment.target: Allow search suggestions in address bar

segment.source: Allow sending intranet traffic to Internet Explorer
segment.target: Allow sending intranet traffic to Internet Explorer

segment.source: Specifies where to find the list of web sites that will open in Enterprise mode.
segment.target: Specifies where to find the list of web sites that will open in Enterprise mode.

segment.source: Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots
segment.target: Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots

segment.source: Specifies whether the device can use location services information.
segment.target: Specifies whether the device can use location services information.

segment.source: Allows devices to receive advertisements over Bluetooth.
segment.target: Allows devices to receive advertisements over Bluetooth.

segment.source: Allow Bluetooth connectable mode Important: This setting is no longer supported by Windows 10 and will be removed in the future.
segment.target: Allow Bluetooth connectable mode Important: This setting is no longer supported by Windows 10 and will be removed in the future.

segment.source: Configure whether Windows Antitheft mode is enabled.
segment.target: Configure whether Windows Antitheft mode is enabled.

segment.source: Enable this setting to allow automatic updates.
segment.target: Enable this setting to allow automatic updates.

segment.source: Then, configure one of several settings to control update behavior.
segment.target: Then, configure one of several settings to control update behavior.

segment.source: Deploy the configuration policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the configuration policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts In the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts In the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
